events.title: Yalta Conference Begins
events.description: World leaders Franklin D. Roosevelt, Winston Churchill, and Joseph Stalin meet at Yalta in Crimea to discuss the postwar reorganization of Europe.
events.significance: The conference shaped the post-World War II order and led to the division of Germany and the formation of the United Nations.

events.title: George Washington Elected First U.S. President
events.description: George Washington is unanimously elected as the first President of the United States by the Electoral College.
events.significance: Marked the establishment of the United States government under the new Constitution.

events.title: Terracotta Army Unearthed
events.description: Chinese farmers accidentally discover the Terracotta Army in Xi'an, China. The archaeological find includes thousands of life-sized clay soldiers buried with the first Emperor of China, Qin Shi Huang.
events.significance: Provided invaluable insight into ancient Chinese art, military, and burial practices.

events.title: Facebook Launched
events.description: Mark Zuckerberg launches 'Thefacebook,' a social networking service initially limited to Harvard students.
events.significance: This event marks the beginning of one of the largest social media platforms, significantly impacting global communication and social interaction.
